remarks.para: May be inoperative provided a visual flight control check is accomplished before each departure.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "(SPECIFIC CONTROL SURFACE INDICATION) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

warning.para: ENSURE ALL PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL CONTROL SURFACES TO PREVENT INJURY OR DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: Establish communications between the flight deck and a ground observer.
Pressurize all hydraulic systems (Engine and/or Electric Hydraulic Pumps running).
Observe that five left wing spoilers extend
Observe left aileron up, right aileron down

entry.para: Spoilers 1,2,3, and 5 will extend approximately 45 degrees. Spoiler 6 will extend approximately 30 degrees. Spoiler 4 will not extend.
Ailerons move up 20 degrees and down 20 degrees.

numlitem.para: Observe that five right wing spoilers extend (as above)
Observe right aileron up, left aileron down (as above)

entry.para: Control Column Full Aft, then Full Forward
Observe both elevators up, then down
Elevator deflection will be trailing edge approximately 30 degrees up and 20 degrees down.
Push Pedals for Full Left Rudder, then Full Right Rudder
Observe rudder move left, then right
Hold the nose wheel steering tiller stationary during rudder check to prevent nose wheel movement.
Rudder deflection will be approximately 30 degrees left or right.
